titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 253: Manuscript of an evangelist and prebendary of the minor orders
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: The manuscript has been conserved and many of the leaves have been attached to supplied stubs
Manuscript on paper except for the outer two bifolia of the first gathering (front flyleaf 3, fols. 1, 6, 7)
Flyleaves of modern paper except for the third front flyleaf, which is parchment and the first leaf of the first gathering

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a late fourteenth-century compilation of Franciscan documents, including a provincial constitution of 1359, the form of the vow taken by a man joining the order, and eleven of the twelve statutes adopted by the General Chapter of Assisi in 1354, with the very end of the eleventh and the twelfth missing. The manuscript is written by multiple hands and has occasional marginal notes.

msItem.title: Manuscript of an evangelist and prebendary of the minor orders
msItem.author: Franciscans

supportDesc.extent: iii+55+ii; 193 x 130 mm bound to 195 x 140 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Fols. 21-32 seem to be foliated 145-156, upper left verso; fols. 33-55 seem to be foliated 49-60, 73-83, upper left verso, without loss of text between 60 and 73

layoutDesc.layout: Written in one column of twenty-four to twenty-five lines; frame-ruled in ink with double horizontal bounding lines; prickings visible; written area: 135 x 90 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrication in red; two- and three-line initials in red

history.provenance: Victor Christ Library; Purchased by the Free Library through the George S. Pepper Fund
